questionTitle: In the jar there was a ________ which looked like jam.
Because his argument was so confusing, ________ people understood it.
We are ________ him to arrive at any moment.
You ________ worry about paying the gas bill - I've already done it.
I've made an appointment for 10 o'clock. Is that ________ for you?
You look ________ you've seen a ghost!
You ________ blame yourself for the accident. It wasn't your fault.
Naturally I'm ________ that I didn't pass the examination but I'll do better next time.
Today's newspaper has ________ interesting article on space travel.
Your brother is much taller ________ you.
My aunt and uncle always quarrelled about their tea; she liked it strong but he wanted it ________.
Getting divorced was a ________ decision for us to make, but I'm sure it was the right one.
Mr Smith was ________ in a road accident.
We expected him at eight but he finally ________ at midnight.
Buses into town run ________ twenty minutes or so.
Can you possibly make ________ what he has written here?
I can't say what her name is though it is ________.
anwers: on the top of my tongue
on the tip of my tongue

questionTitle: Whether or not to abolish corporal punishment in schools is still ________ in educational circles.
I ________ a nice present yesterday.
As bold as ________ = cheeky, impudent.
